gurmukhi: bhuq kwl ieh BwNiq ibqwXo ] mIAwN Kwn jMmU kh AwXo ]
transliteration: Bahout Kaal Eh Bhaant(i) Bitaayo|| Moondan Khaan Janmoondkah Aayo||
translation: Much time passed in this way, Mian Khan came (from Delhi) to Jammu (for collection of revenue).

gurmukhi: AlP Kwn nwdOx pTwvw ] BImcMd qn bYr bFwvw ]1]
transliteration: Alaf Khaan Naadaoun Pathaavaa|| Bhoomchannd Tan Bair Badhaavaa||1||
translation: He sent Alif Khan to Nadaun, who developed enmity towards Bhim Chand (the Chief of Kahlur).1.

gurmukhi: ju`D kwj niRp hmY bulwXo ] Awip qvn kI Er isDwXo ]
transliteration: Juddh Kaaj Nrip Hamai Bulaayo|| Aap(i) Tavan Koo Or Sidhaayo||
translation: Bhim Chnad called me for assistance and himself went to face (the enemy).

gurmukhi: iqn kT gV nvrs pr bwNDXo ] qIr quPMg nrysn swDXo ]2]
transliteration: Tin Kath Gad Navras Par Baandhyo|| Toor Touphan Daresan Saadhyo||2||
translation: Alif Khan prepared a wooden fort of the hill of Navras. The hill-chief also prepared their arrows and guns.2.

gurmukhi: qhw rwj isMGM blI BImcMdM ] ciVE rwm isMGM mhw qyj vMdM ]
transliteration: Tahaa Raaj Singhan Badoo Bhoomchanndan|| Chadio Raam Singhan Mahaa Tej Vandan||
translation: With brave Bhim Chand, there were Raj Singh, illustrious Ram Singh,

gurmukhi: suKM dyv gwjI jswrot rwjM ] cVy kRu`D kIny kry srb kwjM ]3]
transliteration: Soukhannddev Gadjoo Jasdarot Raajan|| Chade Kruddh Koone Dare Sarab Kaajan||3||
translation: And Sukhdev Gaji of Jasrot, were full of fury and managed their affairs with enthusiasm.3.

gurmukhi: piRQIcMd ciFE fFy fFvwrM ] cly is`D huAY kwj rwjM suDwrM ]
transliteration: Prithoochannd Chadhio Dadhe Dadhvaaran|| Chale Siddh Huai Kaaj Raajan Sudhaaran||
translation: There came also the brave Prithi Chand of Dadhwar after having made arrangements regarding the affairs of his state.

gurmukhi: krI FUk FoAM ikrpwlcMdM ] htwey sbY mwir kY bIr biRMdM ]4]
transliteration: Daroo Dhook Dhoan Kirpaalchanndan|| Hataae Sabai Daar(i) Kai Boor Brindan||4||
translation: Kirpal Chand (of Kanara) arrived with ammunition and drove back and killed many of the warriors (of Bhim Chand).4.

gurmukhi: duqIX FoA FUkY vhY mwir auqwrI ] Kry dwNq pIsY CuBY C`qRDwrI ]
transliteration: Doutooya Dhoa Dhookai Vahai Daar(i) Outdaroo|| Kdare Daant Poosai Chhoubhai Chhatradhdaroo||
translation: When for the second time, the forces of Bhim Chand advanced, they were beaten back downwards to the great sorrow of (the allies of Bhim Chand),

gurmukhi: auqY vY Qry bIr bMbY bjwvYN ] qry BUp TwNFy bfo soku pwvYN ]5]
transliteration: Outao Vao Kdare Boor Banbai Bajaavain|| Dare Bhoop Thaandhe Bado Sok(u) Paavain||5||
translation: The warriors on the hill sounded trumpets, while the chiefs below were filled with remorse.5.

gurmukhi: qbY BImcMdM kIXo kop AwpM ] hnUmwn ky mMqR ko muK jwpM ]
transliteration: Tabai Bhoomchanndan Kooyo Kop Aapan|| Hanoomaan Ke Mantra Ko Mouch Jaapan||
translation: Then Bhim Chand was filled with great ire and began to recite the incantations of Hanuman.

gurmukhi: sbY bIr bolo hmY BI bulwXM ] qbY FoA kY kY su nIky isDwXM ]6]
transliteration: Sabai Boor Bolo Hamaibhoo Bulaayan|| Tabai Dhoa Kai Kais U Nooke Sidhaayan||6||
translation: He called all his warriors and also called me. Then all assembled and advanced for attack.6.

gurmukhi: sbY kop kY kY mhw bIr PUky ] cly bwirby bwr ko ijau BBUky ]
transliteration: Sabai Kop Kai Kai Mahaa Boor Phooke|| Chale Baaribe Baar Ko Jio Bhabhooke||
translation: All the great warriors marched forward with great ire like a flame over a fence of dry weeds.
